arts.sum: Minute-by-minute match report from Vicarage Road as Ryan Andrews' cracking strike makes it five home wins in a row.

arts.ttl: Bristol City player ratings vs Watford: Max Bird stands out as forwards regret wasted chances
arts.sum: Dickie started back-to-back games for the first time in a couple of months and he didn't quite seem at his commanding best. The centre-back didn't have the best of games against his former club last time out, but he looked much more assured at Vicarage Road.
Watford moved back into the play-off positions after Ryan Andrews' second-half strike secured a 1-0 win at home to Bristol City.

arts.ttl: Watford back into play-off places following victory against Bristol City
arts.sum: Ryan Andrews scored the only goal of the game.

arts.ttl: Bristol City team predicted team vs Watford as Liam Manning set to consider formation change
arts.sum: Similarly, Manning confirmed in his post-match press conference at Ashton Gate that the decision to take off George Earthy at half-time against Scott Parker's side was just a tactical one, rather than a result of an injury after the West Ham loanee went to ground following a tackle in the opening period. Bristol City and Liam Manning will be looking to quickly get back to winning ways against play-off-chasing Watford when they travel to travel to Vicarage Road on Tuesday and the Reds boss could be set to opt for a change of system.

arts.ttl: Chelsea set to sign 15-year-old wonderkid with the Blues in talks over compensation deal with Watford for ex-Arsenal cult hero's son
arts.sum: KIERAN GILL: The teenaged attacker has been playing in higher age groups for Watford, including their Under-21s, for whom he has scored despite still only being 15.

arts.ttl: Tom Cleverley wary of Bristol City threat after Ashton Gate visit ahead of Watford showdown
arts.sum: Watford boss Tom Cleverley has admitted his side will have to be "very efficient" in possession to break down Bristol City when the Hornets host the Reds at Vicarage Road on Tuesday. Bristol City Live is now on WhatsApp and we want you to join our community.

arts.ttl: Watford beat Everton to go top of Under-21 League Cup group
arts.sum: The Hornets are now top of their group in the Premier League Cup with two games left to play.

arts.ttl: Can Watford turn narrow home wins into more commanding results?
arts.sum: Seven wins and four draws from 11 home league games but Hornets haven't been putting visitors to the sword.

arts.ttl: League Two boss explains 'problem' facing Bristol City attacker after Ashton Gate loan exit
arts.sum: Doncaster Rovers boss Grant McCann has admitted the good form of the forwards in his squad so far this season is proving to be a "problem" for Bristol City loanee Ephraim Yeboah. Although Rovers boss McCann has been impressed by Yeboah's technical ability, the form of the likes of Kyle Hurst and Luke Molyneux in particular has made it hard for him to hand the City loanee opportunities.
